description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows kernel-mode driver elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-43640), follow the steps below:

1. Identify the build number of your Windows operating system using the following command in Command Prompt:
   ```
   ver
   ```
2. Download the relevant update package for your build:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (32-bit): [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)

3. Install the downloaded update by running the installer and following the prompts to complete the installation.
4. Restart your system after applying the update to ensure that the changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update addresses a double free vulnerability in the Windows kernel that may allow an attacker to elevate privileges. It is recommended to ensure your system is fully updated to prevent potential exploitation of this issue.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify your system's architecture (32-bit or 64-bit).
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
